That's quite a grasp Tomas Alfredson has on the elements of human emotion.

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. The only reason I am commenting is because I finally figured out why Dr. Cox was bald. The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all over the place and several skeletons and bodies half eaten. So what are they going to do next? I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie in a theater..

However, I was too tired to watch John Carter and fell asleep with approximately 20 minutes left to the movie. Since I missed the ending, now I can go see the movie again and guess what kind of ending it has? Just kidding......

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, Jerry MEA Culpa, Tom. Originally a Dante Basco's 8 minute payback film, it found a second life when a new recent college grad tried to make it his cut development project, a disaster!

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more recent Disney fairy tales, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to me is that the picture was pretty much devoid of magic. The good points are a few catchy songs, and certain landscapes looking like a fantasy mural found in certain churches in the Middle Ages.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures across the Universe in their space ships, along with their pets, the felines. A few heavily armed groups survive on the Earth continent of Africa. Yet, the wild feral cats are affected by the depleted and dying radioactive pollen.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is the first of three AVENGING force films, all of them are based on the TV series. In this movie Joe Armstrong gets fired from the army and he is betrayed by Kathie Peil but beside a beautiful female lead there are actually no other love lines in this film,
